New Records: Norman Powell posted his first career double-double with 31 points and 12 rebounds.
Key Match Events: The Clippers took a 78-73 lead into the fourth quarter and began the period with a 16-5 run.
The Kings cut a 16-point fourth-quarter deficit to four with under three minutes to play, but Powell and Amir Coffey hit consecutive 3-pointers to push the lead back to double digits.
Pre-Game Insights: The Clippers, looking to hold down the fort until star Kawhi Leonard returns from right knee inflammation, is above.500 for the first time this season after a 2-4 start.
Post-Match Reflections: Powell has blossomed early this season, scoring 20 points or more for the eighth straight game and finally notching a double-double in his 10th season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings are in the bottom five in the NBA in 3-point shooting, entering the game at a 32.5% clip.
Others: Up next, the Clippers host the Toronto Raptors on Saturday, while the Kings are at the Phoenix Suns on Sunday.
